meta.content: Our District serves about 5,200 students from Kindergarten through 12th grade in 11 regular schools and 4 public charter schools, with a total of approximately 500 employees. We focus on every child, every day.

Welcome to Lincoln County Schools - K-12 School District in Oregon

Our District serves about 5,200 students from Kindergarten through 12th grade in 11 regular schools and 4 public charter schools, with a total of approximately 500 employees. We focus on every child, every day.

div.p: For help with Chromebooks – Click Here / Para obtener ayuda con Chromebooks – haga clic aquí

Our District serves about 5,500 students from Kindergarten through 12th grade in 11 regular schools and 3 public charter schools, with a total of approximately 600 employees. We focus on every child, every day, future ready.

div.class: widget_text widget-odd widget-last widget-first widget-1 widget_custom_html content-widget

a.span: Here are some guidelines to help staff be safe and

img.alt:
Here are some guidelines to help staff be safe and healthy and implement social distancing measures while preparing, handing out, or delivering meals, instructional packets, or other items.
https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/04/15/lcsd-covid-19-safety-precautions-lcsd-covid-19-precauciones-de-seguridad/

a.span:
WHAT IS ‘DISTANCE LEARNING FOR ALL?
Our distric

img.alt:
WHAT IS ‘DISTANCE LEARNING FOR ALL?
Our district, along with all other districts in the state, is implementing a distance learning model in order to connect students with teachers to provide access to grade-level learning. Distance learning is a model in which the teacher and student are not in the same location. Here are some key elements of distance learning: -Every student connects with their teacher(s) – at least once per -Teachers and students prioritize time together to focus on the most important -Together, teachers and families establish consistent routines and a learning environment that leads to -Teachers continue to monitor, report, and record each student’s progress towards learning goals and -Schools provide multiple, flexible opportunities to earn credit for high school
https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/04/14/distance-learning-for-all-a-guide-for-families-aprendizaje-a-distancia-para-todos-una-guia-para-familias/

a.span: Lincoln County residents should be aware of and en

img.alt:
Lincoln County residents should be aware of and encouraged to complete the 2020 US Census for their household. Lincoln County is among the Oregon counties with low ‘Response Rates’ according to information at https://2020census.gov/en/response-rates.html.
For the first time, in 2020 the U.S. Census Bureau will accept responses online. The process will be quick and secure. You can respond to the census in less time than it takes to finish your morning coffee. You’ll still be able to respond by mail.
What matters to you? Schools? Transportation? Hospitals? Data from the census will help inform planning efforts for all these important community resources.
Please help ‘get out the count’ and secure Lincoln County’s – and our community’s – share of federal funding, representation, and planning and support services for the next decade by completing the census at https://2020census.gov/. https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/04/07/2020-census-for-lincoln-county-residents/

a.span: Chromebook Distribution Helping Support Families i

img.alt: Chromebook Distribution Helping Support Families in Preparation of Distance Learning This week, Lincoln County School District began distribution of Chromebooks to facilitate access to Distance Learning. The Chromebooks are assigned, one per household, along with Supplemental Learning packets in anticipation of Distance Learning which will roll out April 13. Any household with a student k-8 may request a device to use while the schools are closed. The households with students 9-12 already have a Chromebook as part of our 1:1 device program. At this time, LCSD has requests for more than 1,200 devices. The devices already in homes is around the same amount. If you have a need for a Chromebook you may sign up online. Links are on this page: https://lincoln.k12.or.us/resources/family/technology/ Esta semana, el Distrito Escolar del Condado de Lincoln comenzó a distribuir Chromebooks para facilitar el acceso a la Educación a Distancia. Los Chromebooks se asignan, uno por hogar, junto con los paquetes de Aprendizaje Suplementario en anticipación del Aprendizaje a Distancia que se lanzará el 13 de abril. Cualquier hogar con un estudiante de kínder a octavo año puede solicitar un dispositivo para usar mientras las escuelas están cerradas. Los hogares con estudiantes de 9-12 ya tienen un Chromebook como parte de nuestro programa de dispositivo 1:… Link: https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/04/03/chromebook-distribution-helping-support-families-in-preparation-of-distance-learning/

a.span: Congratulation to New Principal of Toledo Elementa

img.alt: Congratulation to New Principal of Toledo Elementary: Liz Postlewait! April 1, 2020 (and not an April Fools Day joke!) Dear Toledo Elementary School Parents, Guardians, and Community, It is my pleasure to announce that Liz Postlewait (former vice principal of Toledo Elementary School) has been named the Interim Principal at Toledo Elementary School starting today. Former principal Paul Tucker has decided to resign his position and Liz will be the new principal. Mrs. Postlewait will be starting the process for the selection of a new Vice Principal very soon and the new VP will begin working July 1, 2020. They will be a dynamic duo, and together with every single staff member, the Toledo will rock education for our fantastic Boomer kids. Please join me in wishing Principal Postlewait Best Wishes and Congratulations! Liz is an outstanding instructional leader and will bring continued success to Toledo Elementary School and the Toledo Community. Thank you very much, Dr. Karen Fischer Gray Superintendent Lincoln County SD 1 de abril de 2020 (¡y no una broma del Día de los Inocentes!) Estimados padres, tutores y comunidad de la escuela primaria Toledo: Es un placer anunciar que Liz Postlewait (ex subdirectora de la Escuela Primaria Toledo) ha sido nombrada Directora Interina de… Link: https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/04/01/congratulation-to-new-principal-of-toledo-elementary-liz-postlewait/

a.span: School Based Health Centers Hello student patients

img.alt: School Based Health Centers Hello student patients of the School Based Health Centers (SBHCs)! If you need care during this time when schools are closed, please reach out to 541-265-4947, and we will make arrangements to either "see" you by phone or in person, whichever is most appropriate for you. @LincolnPublicHealth We care about you and want you to continue to get the care you need! ¡Hola, pacientes estudiantes de los Centros de Salud Escolares (SBHC)! Si necesita atención durante este tiempo cuando las escuelas están cerradas, comuníquese con 541-265-4947, y haremos los arreglos para "verlo" por teléfono o en persona, lo que sea más apropiado para usted. ¡Nos preocupamos por usted y queremos que continúe recibiendo la atención que necesita! Link: https://lincoln.k12.or.us/2020/03/31/school-based-health-centers/

div.span: Teaching and Learning Center / District Office

div.p: NON-DISCRIMINATION (Title IX): Lincoln County Schools shall promote non-discrimination and an environment free of harassment based on an individual’s race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, marital status or age or because of the race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, marital status or age of any other persons with whom the individual associates. Discrimination Complaint Procedure

PUBLIC COMPLAINTS: Policies and procedures for public complaints can be found on our Community Relations Policy Page (See "KL" and "KL-AR").
Conocimiento del Proceso de Quejas Públicas
